{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3321958,"name":"Clayton E","username":"Clayton_E","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clayton_e/{size}/6180_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T05:18:25.605Z","cooked":"

We are plugging a Through Bore Encoder into a Spark Max for an Absolute Encoder. We do not have the Absolute Encoder Adapter, instead we are using the Data Port Breakout board with the Black to Ground, Red to 5v, and White to P6. However, as soon as we plug in the breakout board to the Through bore encoder, the Spark Max loses power.

Soldering issue or do we need to enable something through the REV client or code?

Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-03-02T05:18:25.605Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":34,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":192.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":456924,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-kills-spark-max-power","display_username":"Clayton E","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18628,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-kills-spark-max-power/456924/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3322005,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-02T09:09:54.807Z","cooked":"

Sounds like you are correctly following one of the optional setups from the documentation on this page.

Are you plugging in the adapter in the correct orientation shown in this picture?
I have seen this exact same thing happen when the adapter board is plugged in backwards.

image1920×1440 156 KB

Also, according to the specs on the thru-bore encoder page you should probably be using the 3.3V pin:

Yes, that is our setup with the breakout board centered and facing the right direction. I will try the 3.3v.

Looks like it was the through bore encoder killing power to the Max. Swapped out the encoder and its reading now.
